metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0548 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cleanup errors in some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. It was discovered that on some Intel processors, partial data values previously read from a vector register on a physical core may be propagated into unused portions of the store buffer. A local attacker could possible use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20200609.0ubuntu0.18.04.0
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue only affects Intel processors

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20200609.0ubuntu0.18.04.0').
